clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Dolutegravir Removed by Hemodialysis in HIV-infected Patients With End-stage Renal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Removal of Dolutegravir by Hemodialysis in HIV-infected Patients With End-stage Renal Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundaci贸n FLS de Lucha Contra el Sida, las Enfermedades Infecciosas y la Promoci贸n de la Salud y la Ciencia

clinical_study.source: Fundaci贸n FLS de Lucha Contra el Sida, las Enfermedades Infecciosas y la Promoci贸n de la Salud y la Ciencia

brief_summary.textblock: Data on the capacity of hemodialysis to remove dolutegravir (DTG) from plasma in patients with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) on hemodialysis (HD) are lacking. If DTG was removed from plasma by HD, it would be possible to have subtherapeutic drug concentrations at the end of HD sessions.

detailed_description.textblock:
The prevalence of chronic renal disease and end-stage renal disease (ESRD) is increasing in the HIV-positive population. This means that an increasing number of HIV-infected patients will need renal replacement therapy.However, little is known about DTG removal from plasma by HD in patients with ESRD.
Objective: to evaluate the effect of HD on DTG clearance as well as on DTG plasma concentrations at steady state in HIV-infected patients with ESRD undergoing HD.

secondary_outcome.measure: percentage of patients presenting adverse events related to dolutegravir

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Age 1 years old or older.
2. HIV documented infection (western blot)
3. ESRD undergoing routine hemodialysis
4. Stable antiretroviral treatment (no changes within the prior 2 weeks)
5. Signature of informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Inadequate adherence to antiretroviral treatment (<90% in the week prior to inclusion).
2. Clinical evidence or suspicion that the patient will not be able to comply with the study protocol.
